content: नारायणः {@--1@} An epithet of Vishṇu; (the word is thus derived in <ls>Ms. 1. 10</ls>; आपो नारा इति प्रोक्ता आपो वै नरसूनवः . ता यदस्यायनं पूर्वं तेन नारायणः स्मृतः ..). {@--2@} <ab>N.</ab> of an ancient sage said to be a companion of {%Nara%} and to have produced Urvaśī from his thigh: <ab>cf.</ab> ऊरूद्भवा नरसखस्य मुनेः सुरस्त्री <ls>V. 1. 3</ls>; see नरनारायण under नर also. --णी {@--1@} An epithet of Lakṣmī the goddess of wealth. {@--2@} An epithet of Durgā.

नारायण (भट्टनारायण) Author of the Veṇī-Saṃhāra. He must have flourished before the 9th century as his work is frequently quoted by the poet Anandavardhana in his work called ध्यन्यालोक. This poet flourished under the reign of Avantivarman 855-884 <ab>A. D.</ab> (<ls>Rāj. T. 5. 34</ls>)
